p: The whole plant has a fresh fragrance that is emitted when the living leaves are rubbed, and dried specimens retain their strong fragrance. Akha villagers are particularly fond of its scent. Both China and Laos Akha villagers put fleagrass in ear-holes or on caps as decorations or perfume (Fig.Â 4c). Some respondents also claimed that placing fleagrass in their ear-holes or on caps can relieve headaches. The scent is also helpful in relieving nasal congestion.
